page.title: 03Shops
page.content:
The Milburn's shop is a local shop in the village. It is a super market and off licence, they sell quite a variety of things. The Post office takes parcels and letters. The postman collects from the boxes on Monday to Saturday but never on a Sunday. He delivers to the houses once a day. It has a video club. The Butcher's shop on North Side is owned by the Honeymans who also own the field behind. It sells lots of kinds of meat.
Greaves Garage is the only garage in the village. It sells ICI petrol and Austin Rover cars which cost about Â£3400 to Â£15000 depending which one you buy. Also at the garage there is an air pump so you can pump up your tyres. It is quite a big garage and is owned by Mr.Greaves and his daughter.
